authors: President Of The Owner-Operator Independent Drivers Association
description: The trucking industry has long churned through drivers, and the pandemic has made the job even harder.
title: The Supply Chain Needs More Truck Drivers
title_page: The Supply Chain Needs More Truck Drivers - WSJ
maintext:
Some port truckers who make those runs have switched to become long-haul drivers, who move freight over a distance of 250 miles or more, as rates to move goods out of state have skyrocketed. Other drivers have turned to local delivery work, which doesnï¿½t typically involve overnights on the road, or left the industry altogether.
Allison Zaucha for WSJ
